intro: Coffea sambavensis, commonly known as the Sambava coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to Madagascar. This plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces small white flowers that develop into red berries containing the coffee seeds. The plant is typically grown in shaded environments and requires a humid climate with well-drained soil. It is considered a wild species and is not widely cultivated for commercial coffee production.
